security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill file with no executable code. The SKILL.md file defines AI instructions for validating Flyway migrations without embedding any scripts, network calls, or file system access capabilities. The shell commands shown are example prompts for the AI to follow.

content.value_statement: Database migration conflicts and naming errors cause deployment failures and data integrity issues. This skill validates migration files for version conflicts, naming conventions, SQL syntax, and main branch conflicts before deployment.
actual_capabilities: Validates migration file version number sequence and detects duplicates
Verifies main branch conflicts in migration files
Validates basic SQL syntax and idempotency (IF NOT EXISTS)
limitations: Does not execute SQL against a live database
Performs only basic SQL syntax checks, not full validation
Requires git access for main branch conflict checks

use_cases.title: Pre-commit migration validation
use_cases.description: Validate migration files before committing to prevent deployment issues

use_cases.title: CI/CD pipeline integration
use_cases.description: Add migration checks to deployment pipelines to catch issues early

use_cases.title: Migration audit and review
use_cases.description: Audit migration files for compliance with team naming conventions

prompt_templates.title: Basic migration check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the Flyway migrations in backend/src/main/resources/db/migration/

prompt_templates.title: Version conflict check
prompt_templates.scenario: Find duplicate or missing version numbers
prompt_templates.prompt: Find any duplicate version numbers or gaps in the migration sequence

prompt_templates.title: Naming convention check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if all migration files follow the V{version}__{description}.sql naming convention

prompt_templates.title: Main branch comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if any migrations conflict with the main branch by comparing version numbers

output: Idempotency: 12 files use IF NOT EXISTS, 3 files may need review

best_practices: Use IF NOT EXISTS in all CREATE TABLE statements for idempotency
Keep version numbers sequential without gaps
Review migrations with main branch before merging pull requests
anti_patterns: Using custom naming formats instead of Flyway standard
Modifying migrations that have already been applied to main

faq.question: Which database systems does this skill support?
faq.answer: Any database supported by Flyway, including PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, and SQLite.

faq.question: What version number formats are supported?
faq.answer: Flyway supports numeric versions (V1, V2, V10) and semantic versions (V1_0, V1_1) in the naming convention.

faq.question: Can I use this skill in my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, invoke the skill during your build process to validate migrations before deployment.

faq.question: Is my database connection required for validation?
faq.answer: No, this skill validates file names, content structure, and version numbers without connecting to the database.

faq.question: Why are my migrations failing validation?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing IF NOT EXISTS, duplicate version numbers, or non-standard file naming format.

faq.question: How does this compare to Flyway's built-in validation?
faq.answer: This skill provides quick pre-validation without running Flyway. It complements Flyway's validation for early error detection.
